content.question: The slope field for a certain differential equation is shown above. Which of the following statements about a solution <math alttext="y equals, f of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> to the differential equation must be false?

choices.label: The graph of the particular solution that satisfies <math alttext="f of 1, equals negative 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is concave down on the interval <math alttext="0 is less than x, which is less than 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The graph of the particular solution that satisfies <math alttext="f of negative 1, equals 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is concave up on the interval <math alttext="negative 1 is less than x, which is less than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The graph of the particular solution that satisfies <math alttext="f of 0, equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is concave up on the interval <math alttext="negative 1 is less than x, which is less than 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The graph of the particular solution that satisfies <math alttext="f of 0, equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> has a point of inflection at <math alttext="x equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The graph of the particular solution that satisfies <math alttext="f of 0, equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is concave up on the interval <math alttext="negative 1 is less than x, which is less than 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
